citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), Office for Coastal Management (OCM)
citeinfo.title: Anchorage Areas

pubinfo.publish: NOAA's Ocean Service, Office for Coastal Management (OCM)

descript.abstract: An anchorage area is a place where boats and ships can safely drop anchor. These areas are created in navigable waterways when ships and vessels require them for safe and responsible navigation. A variety of designations refer to types of anchorage areas or restrictions, or even to alerts of potential dangers within an area. Every boater and captain should be aware of the various types of areas. These data are intended for coastal and ocean planning. Not for navigation.
descript.purpose: To support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Energy Policy Act, Coastal Zone Management Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.

idinfo.useconst: These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation. https://marinecadastre.gov/about/disclaimer.html

attracc.attraccr: The attributes in this dataset are believed to be accurate.

dataqual.logic: These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.
dataqual.complete: Spatial and attribute properties are believed to be complete, although attribute information has been simplified. Geometric thresholds from original data are preserved. No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness.

horizpa.horizpar: Maximum scale of intended use is 1:80,000.

srcinfo.srccontr: Data from CFR, ENC and RNC were used to compile this dataset.

procstep.procdesc: 1. Go to http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2016-title33-vol1/pdf/CFR-2016-title33-vol1-chapI.pdf, http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2016-title33-vol2/pdf/CFR-2016-title33-vol2-chapI.pdf & http://www.gpo.gov/fdsys/pkg/CFR-2016-title33-vol3/pdf/CFR-2016-title33-vol3-chapIV.pdf and record all anchorage area info into a spreadsheet including lat/long data 2. Import sheet into ArcGIS, convert to xy coordinates, and export as a point feature class 3. Convert point feature class to polygon by connecting corner coordinates and joining attribute info NOTE: Areas from the following locations were not included, as they are all inland locations: Section 110.127 Lake Mohave and Lake Mead, NV and AZ Section 110.127a Lake Powell, UT-AZ Section 110.127b Flaming Gorge Lake, WY-UT Section 110.72c Lake Murray, SC 4. Go to https://encdirect.noaa.gov/ and download the following at full extent: Approach_Anchor_Berth_area, Approach_Anchor_Berth_point Approach_Anchorage_Area, Approach_Anchorage_Area_point Coastal_Anchorage_Area, Coastal_Anchorage_Area_point General_Anchorage_Area, General_Anchorage_Area_point Harbour_Anchor_Berth_area, Harbour_Anchor_Berth_point Harbour_Anchorage_Area, Harbour_Anchorage_Area_point Berthing_Anchorage_Area Overview_Anchorage_Area_point 5. Import all of the polygon layers into a single feature class and the point layers into a separate feature class 6. Buffer the point features to 500 feet 7. Compare between the layers, removing duplicates, and compare to NOAA_RNC continuous raster at ArcGIS on seamlessrnc.nauticalcharts.noaa.gov as a guide 8. Union the polygon and point feature classes with the CFR feature class and merge and combine features where overlap occurs, again giving the CFR features the most importance 9. Fill in any missing attributes using RNC info 10. Delete all superfluous fields 11. Check geometry and project data into WGS 1984 Auxiliary Sphere

enttyp.enttypd: Anchorage areas located in US marine waters.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Anchorage name as described in CFR or RNC
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: NOAA makes no warranties or representations whatsoever regarding the availability, quality, accuracy, content, completeness or suitability for the user's needs of such information. The services, information, and data made available on the Marine Cadastre web site are provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation. http://www.marinecadastre.gov/about/disclaimer.html
